Q-8 The NAEB Radio-Television Bibliography - Burton Paulu
A listing of books and articles on all the nontechnical aspects
of broadcasting covering the period January 1, 19U9 to June 30,
19#. 129 pp. Paper. $2.00
D-5 NAEB Director of Members
The location, call letters, power and frequency, names and
telephone'numbers of all NAEB members. July 1, 1956 (revised
January 1, 1957)* pp* Paper. $2,00
Qn-lj. Clearance Rights and Legal Problems of Educational Radio and Televi¬
sion Stations -" Fredrick S. Siebert
A brief summary covering such points as "Common-Iiaw Portection,"
"Copyright Protections," "Use of copyrighted Literary Materials,"

tractual Obligations." February, 1955* 6 pp. Paper. 50
D-7 Technical Directory - Cecil S. Bidlack, Editor
Listing of technical personnel at educational radio-and tele¬
vision stations, and production stations. February, 1957*
26 pp. Paper. 50$
P-5 NAEB Newsletter
The official monthly periodical of the National Association of
Educational Broadcasters. Approximately 10 pp. Paper. $5® 00
per year. (Back issues 50$ when available).
P^6 NAEB Engineering Newsletter
A quarterly publication giving latest news in the technical field
of interest to educational technical personnel, including "Techni¬
cal Tips," news of personnel, equipment needed'and for sale,
technical reports, etc. •Approximately.6 pp. Paper. $2.00 per
year, (Back issues 500 when available).
P-7 NAEB Journal
A professional journal devoted to articles prepared by leaders
in the field of education and concerned with the utilization of
radio and television for education, as well as the specific field
of educational broadcasting. (Beginning with January, 1958, issue
includes NAEB STV Fact Sheets formerly sold separately. These Fact
Sheets are an effort to digest and centralize available research,
principally on the effectiveness of radio and television as directly
instructional tools. Includes research into techniques of presenta¬
tion, production principles, and content and audience research.)
Published eight times a year (monthly except June, July, August and
September). Approximately 50 pp. Paper, 00 per year. (Back
issues 500 when available.)
